timeline.bodyText:
I don't think we want this behavior.
It seems legitimate to me to do:
getTxn(id).checkStatus()

In this case I would expect the result to return whatever the status was even if it is not OPEN.
If the code doesn't work this way. we should open an issue.
timeline.author: tkaitchuck

timeline.bodyText:
I think what we really want if for the controller client to dictate the exception type.
So instead of converting this, I think we should instead call getThrowingException which will just pass up whatever the underlying error was.

timeline.message:
no throw from Transaction.checkStatus

Signed-off-by: Ravi Rajamani <ravi.rajamani@emc.com>

Use Futures.getThrowingException instead of Futures.getAndHandleExceptions

Signed-off-by: Ravi Rajamani <ravi.rajamani@emc.com>

timeline.bodyText:
Observation : The abort Transaction operations on the controller are idempotent, hence calling an abortTransaction() successively will not throw an error.(TnxFailedException or any other error).
The controller client will throw a TxnFailedException if the txn id is not found by the controller during abort().
